item.title: Colorado prisons have experienced some of the harshest impacts...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Colorado prisons have experienced some of the harshest impacts of COVID-19 statewide. Governor Polis must make public health and equity priorities, and ensure that our communities are safe through a comprehensive vaccine distribution plan for prisons.

coloradosun.com/2021/02/12/covid-prisons-vaccination-opinion

Gov. Jared Polis isn’t listening. So far he’s refusing to implement widespread vaccine distribution in prisons in phases 1b or 2 of Colorado’s distribution schedule — despite prisons being one of the settings hardest hit by COVID-19 in the state. There’s a consensus among many experts that...

coloradosun.com

Opinion: Polis must enact a COVID-19 vaccination plan for Colorado’s hard-hit prisons

Gov. Jared Polis isn’t listening. So far he’s refusing to implement widespread vaccine distribution in prisons in phases 1b or 2 of Colorado’s distribution schedule — despite prisons being one of the settings hardest hit by COVID-19 in the state. There’s a consensus among many experts that...Gov. Jared Polis isn’t listening. So far he’s refusing to implement widespread vaccine distribution in prisons in phases 1b or 2 of Colorado’s distribution schedule — despite prisons being one of the settings hardest hit by COVID-19 in the state. item.title: Your data should always be protected when using government...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Your data should always be protected when using government services. We are urging lawmakers to support legislation establishing privacy protections that would require a warrant or subpoena to access personal data. Read more: http://acluco.org/3qcOwu5

The Colorado Immigrants Rights Coalition said it obtained more than 200 emails between the state agency and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents. The advocacy group characterized the state employees

coloradopolitics.com

Bill would ensure Colorado DMV doesn't share immigrants' information

The Colorado Immigrants Rights Coalition said it obtained more than 200 emails between the state agency and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents. item.title: The Larimer County District Court dismissed Adam Wiemold’s...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

The Larimer County District Court dismissed Adam Wiemold’s 2018 citation for  “camping” in his car, for its violation of the Eighth Amendment. This ruling must set the stage to end the unconstitutional camping bans that target people experiencing homelessness statewide.

https://www.westword.com/…/judge-tosses-fort-collins-campin…

He worked in a homeless shelter, but couldn't stay there.

westword.com

Judge Rules Fort Collins Camping Ban Case Violated Eighth Amendment

He worked in a homeless shelter, but couldn't stay there.He worked in a homeless shelter, but couldn't stay there.
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: The DOC is failing incarcerated people with permanent...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

The DOC is failing incarcerated people with permanent disabilities and illnesses by disregarding their responsibility to save lives through special needs parole. They must take steps to safely release people who are at risk. This failure to act is fatal.

https://www.cpr.org/…/colorado-dept-of-corrections-special…/

Advocates, lawmakers: state isn't doing enough to get sick inmates out of prison before they die.

cpr.org

Advocates Call For Reform As ‘People Are Needlessly Dying In Prison’ During The Pandemic

Advocates, lawmakers: state isn't doing enough to get sick inmates out of prison before they die.Advocates, lawmakers: state isn't doing enough to get sick inmates out of prison before they die.

ACLU of Colorado

Join the fight for civil rights and civil liberties. ACLU of Colorado is hiring an Executive Assistant. Find out more and apply today at: https://aclu-co.org/about-us/work-aclu/

item.title: Protecting and supporting our immigrant communities requires...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Protecting and supporting our immigrant communities requires actively using your power to uplift people through real, concrete change. Senator Hickenlooper must stop making empty promises, and ensure that his words coincide with decisive actions.

https://www.thedenverchannel.com/…/hickenlooper-says-he-rem…

On Monday, Colorado's Democratic National Committee delegation sent a letter to the state party chair calling for the public censure of freshman U.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper after voting in favor of an non-binding amendment that would block undocumented immigrants from receiving stimulus payments

thedenverchannel.com

Hickenlooper says he remains 'committed' to immigration issues after vote on stimulus payments

On Monday, Colorado's Democratic National Committee delegation sent a letter to the state party chair calling for the public censure of freshman U.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper after voting in favor of an non-binding amendment that would block undocumented immigrants from receiving stimulus paymentsOn Monday, Colorado's Democratic National Committee delegation sent a letter to the state party chair calling for the public censure of freshman U.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper after voting in favor of an non-binding amendment that would block undocumented immigrants from receiving stimulus payments
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: In 2018, Adam Wiemold, an unhoused Fort Collins man, was charged...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

In 2018, Adam Wiemold, an unhoused Fort Collins man, was charged with illegal "camping" by Fort Collins Police for sleeping in his vehicle at a designated rest area. Today we announced that the Larimer County District Court ruled that the City of Fort Collins violated the Constitution when it prosecuted Mr. Wiemold. Read more about the court's decision: https://aclu-co.org/victory-in-fort-collins-court-rules-ca…/
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Join us on Thursday, February 11 at 12 p.m. for our annual...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us on Thursday, February 11 at 12 p.m. for our annual Legislative Preview.

Get engaged with our policy priorities and discover how you can collaborate with us this legislative session. You will hear from our Public Policy Director, Denise Maes, on our legislative priorities, which include criminal legal reform, immigrants’ rights, and more. We need your help to ensure Colorado continues to be a leader in civil right and civil liberties. This is a virtual event, and you are encouraged to bring your lunch!

RSVP: http://bit.ly/2LanmVp
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Last Thursday, Senator John Hickenlooper voted to block vital...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Last Thursday, Senator John Hickenlooper voted to block vital Covid-19 stimulus payments to undocumented immigrants. Approximately 19.8 million immigrant essential workers currently risk their lives under the constant threat of exposure. The Senator's vote to deny critical relief to people who need it most was an affront to every essential worker, immigrant & Coloradan.

TAKE ACTION: Urge Senator Hickenlooper to support impacted communities and take every opportunity to deliver necessary aid and protection to all Coloradans. http://acluco.org/39YtHfZ
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: La semana pasada, el senador Hickenlooper votó en contra de los...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

La semana pasada, el senador Hickenlooper votó en contra de los pagos de estímulo vital a las personas indocumentadas. Hoy, 300 defensores pidieron al senador que mantenga su palabra y proteja a TODOS los habitantes de Colorado. El senador Hickenlooper no puede elegir cuando se preocupa por los inmigrantes. O está comprometido a proteger a todos los habitantes de Colorado, todo el tiempo o no lo está. Es tan simple como eso.
https://aclu-co.org/colorado-coalition-condemns-hickenloop…/
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Last week Senator John Hickenlooper voted against vital stimulus...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Last week Senator John Hickenlooper voted against vital stimulus payments to undocumented people. Today, 300 advocates called on the senator to keep his word and protect ALL Coloradans. Sen Hickenlooper doesn’t get to pick and choose when he cares about immigrants. He's either committed to protecting all Coloradans, all of the time or he’s not. It's as simple as that.

https://aclu-co.org/colorado-coalition-condemns-hickenloop…/
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: Who we choose to remember matters. Born in 1858, William Dorsey...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Who we choose to remember matters. Born in 1858, William Dorsey Swann is the earliest recorded American to take legal and political steps to defend the queer community’s right to gather without the threat of criminalization, suppression, or police violence.

We honor William Dorsey Swann's leadership to ensure that the community had the right to be included in the promises and protections of the Constitution, regardless of their sexual orientation and gender identity. #BlackHistoryMonth
item.author: ACLU of Colorado

item.title: In the midst of a public health crisis, Senator John...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

In the midst of a public health crisis, Senator John Hickenlooper has voted to block stimulus payments to undocumented immigrants. This is particularly cruel given how many immigrants have put their lives at risk for us — including the 1.7 million immigrant medical and health care workers.

Colorado Immigrant Rights Coalition - CIRC

CIRC roundly and whole-heartedly condemns John W. Hickenlooper's shocking anti-immigrant vote yesterday to deprive thousands of Colorado immigrant families the ...help that they desperately need in this pandemic. His vote in the US Senate to uphold a budget amendment to block much needed covid relief for immigrant Coloradans is a slap in the face to the record number of Colorado voters who showed up in November to send a message that they are done with the hateful, anti-immigrant sentiment in Washington DC. Coloradans expect better from their representatives.

See MoreU.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper angered immigration activists and some fellow Colorado Democrats on Thursday when he supported a non-binding budget amendment aimed at prohibiting people who are in the …

denverpost.com

Sen. John Hickenlooper frustrates immigration activists with vote to block some from stimulus checks

John Hickenlooper angered immigration activists and some fellow Colorado Democrats on Thursday when he supported a non-binding budget amendment aimed at prohibiting people who are in the …U.S. Sen. item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

In a moving new video, Justin Simmons, activist and NFL athlete for the Denver Broncos, opens up about the personal reason he supports the Redemption Campaign, the impact of growing up Black in America & why he is using his platform to champion social change. https://bit.ly/3rnNdIU

item.title: Justin Simmons, Alexander Johnson and De’Vante Bausby,...
item.content:encoded:
ACLU of Colorado

Justin Simmons, Alexander Johnson and De’Vante Bausby, activists and NFL professional athletes for the Denver Broncos teamed up with ACLU of Colorado urging Governor Jared Polis to use his clemency powers to safely release medically vulnerable people from prison.
